properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 30 at 6:09PM MST until January 30 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
At 609 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from near Granite Springs Reservoir to 7 miles west of
Grover, moving south at 35 mph.

HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and
blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph.

SOURCE...Whiteout conditions observed.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

This includes the following highways...
Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 23.
Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 338 and 374.

Locations impacted include...
Cheyenne, South Greeley, Federal, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Crystal
Lake Campground, Granite Springs Reservoir, Ranchettes, Granite
Springs Campground, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, North Cheyenne, Horse
Creek, Warren Af Base, Fox Farm-College and South Greeley High.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits.
Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions,
making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped
vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow
squall arrives.

NWSheadline: A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MST FOR SOUTHWESTERN LARAMIE COUNTY
